title: Sun square Moon
summary: A moment of friction between conscious intention and emotional needs. Motivation and mood pull in different directions, creating tension that requires adjustment rather than force. The opportunity is to refine timing and expectations.

meaning.headline: What you want to do and what you need may not match.

frames.text: Sun–Moon squares highlight tension between intention and emotional reality, making misalignment harder to ignore.
This aspect asks for adjustment in pacing or approach rather than pushing through discomfort.
Irritability or distraction can surface when internal needs are unmet.
Clarity improves when you acknowledge emotional constraints.
This means emotional conflict or inevitable frustration.

frictions: Misreading mood as a problem to fix

do: Pause to assess emotional capacity before acting.
Adjust expectations or timing instead of pushing harder.
Name the source of friction without dramatizing it.
Use tension as information about priorities.
Create space for both intention and need.
avoid: Making snap decisions to relieve tension

reusable_lines.text: Tension is a signal to adjust, not a reason to push.
Timing matters as much as intention.

forbidden_claims: Predicting emotional conflict or negative outcomes
allowed_framing: Contextual framing: 'if things feel out of sync…'

sources: Sun–Moon square as intention/emotion tension archetype
